elements.content: <ce:section-title>Abstract</ce:section-title><ce:simple-para view="all">The reaction of diglycolic acid O(CH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>COOH)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> with Cu(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O and hydrated gadolinium nitrate at pH 7 produced a novel LnCu mixed metal complex: [Gd<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>Cu<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>{O(CH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>COO)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>}<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>·9H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O], which was characterized by elemental analysis, IR spectrum and X-ray crystallography. In the complex, the Gd<ce:sup loc="post">3+</ce:sup> ions and the Cu<ce:sup loc="post">2+</ce:sup> ions are connected by the carboxylate groups of the ligand molecules, thus resulting in the formation of the complicated network structure.</ce:simple-para>
elements.clean_text:
Abstract
The reaction of diglycolic acid O(CH2COOH)2 with Cu(NO3)2·2H2O and hydrated gadolinium nitrate at pH 7 produced a novel LnCu mixed metal complex: [Gd2Cu3{O(CH2COO)2}6·9H2O], which was characterized by elemental analysis, IR spectrum and X-ray crystallography. In the complex, the Gd3+ ions and the Cu2+ ions are connected by the carboxylate groups of the ligand molecules, thus resulting in the formation of the complicated network structure.

metadata.title: Synthesis and crystal structure of a novel lanthanide-copper mixed metal complex: Gd2Cu3{O(CH2COO)2}6 · 9H2O
